author: legomaniac
title: Race to the top!
review:
If you love Octan Racing theme, then this is for you. The car resembles a Pikes Peak Hill Climb Racer. Cars that go fast around Pikes Peak in Colorado.

Lovely green red and white Octan color scheme as always. New wheels look like the wheels on most creator sets as one side is racing style pattern and the other is steel rim look. Tires are also nicely detailed. Rolls well too. Has 6 stickers to put on. There is a tiny sticker that goes on a 1x2 cheese slope for the instrument panel. Had to use tweeters to get it on straight. 

One thing that is disappointing is the trophy. Its light grey! On the box and online it looks like it was pearl light silver. I would have a facial expression like McKayla Maroney if I received a grey trophy.

Pros

  • Octan team!
  • New black rims and tires
  • New style race car. 
  • Looks awesome

Cons

  • Stickers
  • Ugly grey trophy

Overall this is a fantastic set for $10. Will fit in nicely with the Octan F1 truck. About that trophy....

author: Collingwood
title: Clunky car
review:
I picked up this set as I was looking for a quick build and a small set to get myself just before Christmas.

Generally I'm not overly thrilled with the set, it's a bit clunky and I really, strongly, dislike the trophy that comes with it. 

I dislike that it does not go with the race car from the 2013 set, and again, frankly just find it pretty clunky.  I also dislike the fin at the back, it seems cheap.

The nice thing are the red and green colour pieces.  

I could see this set being good for a young child as they would likely really enjoy racing the car and for the price, you could easily get a couple of them to race.

For me, an adult that likes to build sets and display them, I just don't find it that attractive.

author: CortezTheKiller
title: Best small race car for a while
review:
Nice small set for a quick build.  The style of the car is ambiguous - you can either see it as a Pikes Peak racer or a Le Mans type sports car.  Works either way and is a good design: decent size, takes a minifig with ease, and is very sturdy.  I really like the way the spoiler is mounted - reminds me of many an AFOL custom model on the internet.

Personally I would have preferred a different colour scheme.  I know that it is meant to match the Octan range, but for this model I would have liked to see something a bit different and original.

One more thing: some LEGO plastic feels much less solid and substantial than other LEGO plastic, and it seems to be model by model rather than part by part.  I don't know if they have different quality standards in different factories, but the parts on this model definitely fall into the 'feels cheap than other' category.

Pros

  • Nice original design
  • Good playability
  • New rims
  • Much better than recent small car designs e.g. found in the Creator range
  • Lots of potential for customising

Cons

  • Unoriginal colour scheme
  • Stickers - ugh...
  • Lower than normal quality plastic

Writing principally as an AFOL but also as a parent with a KFOL coming 'on stream' soon.

author: ra226
title: Race Cars have come a long way...
review:
We picked this set up for my son for his birthday--and I mean literally, the day of his birth, so it'll be a while before he can actually play with it.  Meanwhile, I can enjoy it for him!  

This Race Car has a clean, fast look, thanks to multiple layers of curved tiles blending into one another, and an almost completely studless design.  It looks good from just about any angle--personally, I love the lights, and particularly, the tail lights (a pair of red, round tiles on each side, which very much resemble those on a Ferrari).  While I like the styling of the spoiler, it feels a bit too tall to me.  I'm very glad the wheels are black and not grey--really gives them a stock car feel.

I don't personally care much about accessories, but those who do may find this set lacking.  The only addition besides the car and driver is a trophy, which really should have been chrome silver.  I could also see including some kind of minimal finish line, or maybe a girl with a checkered flag or something, but at $10, I'm happy with what I got.

Pros

  • Traditional Octan color scheme of Red, White, and Green
  • Almost completely studless design
  • Layered curves give a detailed yet streamlined look
  • Not just a steering wheel, but an instrument panel, too
  • Nicely detailed minifig, torso is printed front and back

Cons

  • Lacking in accessories, and the trophy would have been far better in chrome silver
  • Stickers, if that bothers you (I had no problem with these, and they look nice)

I found myself comparing it to my own first "Lego Race Car," set #6634, the Shell stock car.  This set, from 1986, looks absolutely archaic now, but they do share the same yellow and transparent headlights.  I also miss the hinged roof of the old days--having to partially dismantle Lego to get the guy in somehow feels like cheating.

This is a perfect stand-alone $10 set, and I'm looking forward, in a few years, to giving it to my son.  Meanwhile, his sister and I will "take good care of it" for him...

author: Faire
title: My son's first LEGO.
review:
Well, my son turned 2 this spring. And he got this as his first real LEGO ever (I am not counting Duplo, of course) for his delayed birthday. Sigh... Anyway.

Box/Instructions

Standard.

Parts

Lots of studless parts, very different from LEGO cars in my days.

Minifigures

Yep, present.

The build

I really like it. I was a bit surprised with the final size, it's quite big. I like the parts, they aren't too unique but fit in the place really well.

The completed model

Very aerodynamic look, almost no studs to be seen. Both front and rear lights are great. It drives very well. Feels quite solid, looks far better than I expected.

Overall opinion

Bargain for its price!

author: germancho
title: Not great for racing
review: It's a sleek and colorful race car set, but ironically, it's not very good for racing. It has very bad balance, and it tends to skid on its rear after you give it a good push. Parts-wise, I appreciate the black rims and trophy.
